summary: Albanian is a unique Indo-European language spoken by around 7.5 million people. It's the main language of Albania and Kosovo, and many Albanian people live in other countries like Greece, Italy, and the USA. The language has two main dialects, Gheg and Tosk, which are similar but have different sounds. Albanian has a long history, with early written records from the 13th century, and it's thought to have developed from ancient Illyrian languages. Standard Albanian, based on Tosk, is the official language used today.
title: Albanian language
